intro: Cischweinfia kroemeri, commonly known as the red hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink and orange. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it a distinctive addition to tropical and subtropical landscapes.
